BPM To Seconds.name: BPM To Seconds
BPM To Seconds.description: The BPM To Seconds node calculates a beat time in seconds from the given beats per minute (BPM), beat multiplier, and divisions of a whole note.

inputs.name: BPM
inputs.description: The input target BPM.

inputs.name: Beat Multiplier
inputs.description: The multiplier value to apply to the BPM.

inputs.name: Division of Whole Note
inputs.description: The divisions of a whole note.

outputs.name: Seconds
outputs.description: The output beat time in seconds.

Envelope Follower.name: Envelope Follower
Envelope Follower.description: The Envelope Follower node outputs an envelope from an input audio signal.

inputs.name: In
inputs.description: The input audio signal.

inputs.name: Attack Time
inputs.description: The attack time (in seconds).

inputs.name: Release Time
inputs.description: The release time (in seconds).

inputs.name: Peak Mode
inputs.description:
The following-method of the envelope follower:

  MS: Envelope follows a running Mean Squared of the audio signal.
  RMS: Envelope follows a running Root Meat Squared of the audio signal.
  Peak: Envelope follows the peaks in the audio signal.

outputs.name: Envelope
outputs.description: The output envelope value (block rate).

outputs.name: Audio Envelope
outputs.description: The output envelope value (audio rate).

Flanger.name: Flanger
Flanger.description: The Flanger node applies a flanger effect to the input audio.

inputs.name: In Audio
inputs.description: The input audio signal to apply the flanger effect to.

inputs.name: Modulation Rate
inputs.description: The Low-Frequency Oscillator (LFO) rate that varies the delay time (in Hz). This value is clamped at block rate.

inputs.name: Modulation Depth
inputs.description: The LFO amplitude (strength) that scales the delay time.

inputs.name: Center Delay
inputs.description: The center delay amount (in milliseconds).

inputs.name: Mix Level
inputs.description: The balance between original and delayed signal. The value should be between 0 and 1.0. For example, a value of 0.5 uses equal amounts of each signal and a value greater than  0.5 uses more delayed signal than non-delayed signal.

outputs.name: Out Audio
outputs.description: The output audio signal with the flanger effect applied.

Get WaveTable From Bank.name: Get WaveTable From Bank
Get WaveTable From Bank.description: The Get WaveTable From Bank node retrieves (or generates an interpolated) WaveTable from a given WaveTable Bank asset.

inputs.name: WaveTableBank
inputs.description: The WaveTable Bank asset to retrieve or generate an interpolated WaveTable from.

inputs.name: TableIndex
inputs.description: The index of the WaveTable to retrieve. If set between two whole values, the WaveTables located at the two closest indices are mixed together. The value will be adjusted to loop if it is set beyond the range of the WaveTable Bank. For example, if the WaveTable Bank has 3 indices, a value of 3.0 will retrieve the WaveTable at index 0.

outputs.name: Out
outputs.description: The retrieved WaveTable.

InterpTo.name: InterpTo
InterpTo.description: The InterpTo node interpolates between the current value and a target value over a specified time.

inputs.name: Interp Time
inputs.description: The time to interpolate from the current value to the target value.

inputs.name: Target
inputs.description: The value to interpolate to.

outputs.name: Value
outputs.description: The current value.

RingMod.name: RingMod
RingMod.description: The RingMod node performs ring modulation with a carrier signal and a modulator signal.

inputs.name: In Carrier
inputs.description: The carrier audio signal.

inputs.name: In Modulator
inputs.description: The modulator audio signal.

outputs.name: Out Audio
outputs.description: The modulated audio signal.

Wave Player.name: Wave Player
Wave Player.description: The Wave Player node is used to play a Sound Wave asset. There are multiple versions of this node in order to support several different channel configurations, such as Mono, Stereo, Quad (4.0), 5.1, and 7.1.

inputs.name: Play / Stop
inputs.description: The Play and Stop triggers start and stop the Wave Player playback at a sample-accurate moment in time.

inputs.name: Wave Asset
inputs.description: The Sound Wave asset played by the Wave Player during playback. This asset uses the same real-time decoders as all other sound sources in Unreal Engine.

inputs.name: Start Time
inputs.description: The time within the Sound Wave asset to begin playing the audio file. This is also referred to as seek time.

inputs.name: Pitch Shift
inputs.description: The Pitch Shift to use for the Wave Player. This is defined in units of semitones to account for the non-linear nature of frequency scaling.

inputs.name: Loop
inputs.description: Whether the Wave Player will loop the audio file or stop when it's finished. This can be toggled at any time during playback from the graph.

inputs.name: Loop Start
inputs.description: The Loop Start indicates at which point in time the Wave Player will loop the audio file.

inputs.name: Loop Duration
inputs.description: The Loop Duration represents the total time the loop will play. Any value other than -1 sets the end point of the loop to the sum of the Loop Start and Loop Duration values, while a value of -1 loops the entire audio file.

outputs.name: On Play
outputs.description: Triggers when the Wave Player's Input Play pin is triggered.

outputs.name: On Finished
outputs.description: Triggers when the Wave Player finishes playing the audio file. This pin will trigger on the same sample point where the audio file finishes playing.

outputs.name: On Nearly Finished
outputs.description: Triggers on the audio rendering block before the audio file is expected to finish playback. This is commonly used to loop back and pick a new audio file variation for the Wave Player.

outputs.name: On Looped
outputs.description: Triggers on the sample where a sound looped based on the looping settings.

outputs.name: On Cue Point
outputs.description:
Triggers when a cue point has been parsed in the Wave Player. Cue points are metadata embedded in audio wave files on import.

Cue points are often used by sound designers to trigger events or loop points in their audio at exact points in time. With this feature, sound designers can procedurally trigger MetaSound behavior based on embedded data in the imported audio wave file.

This pin is executed with sample accuracy, but the integer and label associated with the cue point is read at the block rate. Cue points in the audio wave file that are closer together than the block rate of the MetaSound will only trigger on the last cue point in that block.

outputs.name: Cue Point ID
outputs.description: The ID of the cue point as parsed from the imported audio wave file.

outputs.name: Cue Point Label
outputs.description: The label of the cue point as parsed from the imported audio wave file.

outputs.name: Loop Percent
outputs.description: The current location in the audio wave file within the given loop region.

outputs.name: Playback Location
outputs.description: The current location in the audio wave file as a fraction of the total length of the audio wave file.

outputs.name: Out X
outputs.description: The X channel output of the input Sound Wave asset.

WaveShaper.name: WaveShaper
WaveShaper.description: The WaveShaper node applies a non-linear shaping to the input audio signal.

inputs.name: In
inputs.description: The input audio signal to apply the non-linear shaping to.

inputs.name: Amount
inputs.description: The amount of the non-linear wave shaping to apply.

inputs.name: Bias
inputs.description: The DC offset to apply before wave shaping.

inputs.name: OutputGain
inputs.description: The amount of gain to apply after processing.

outputs.name: Out
outputs.description: The output audio signal with the non-linear shaping applied.

Concatenate.name: Concatenate
Concatenate.description: The Concatenate node concatenates two arrays on a given trigger.

inputs.name: Trigger
inputs.description: The trigger on which to concatenate the input arrays.

inputs.name: Left / Right Array
inputs.description: The input arrays.

outputs.name: Array
outputs.description: The concatenated array.

Get.name: Get
Get.description: The Get node retrieves an element from an array at the given index.

inputs.name: Trigger
inputs.description: The trigger on which to retrieve the specified array element.

inputs.name: Array
inputs.description: The array from which to retrieve an element.

inputs.name: Index
inputs.description: The index of the element to retrieve.

outputs.name: Element
outputs.description: The value of the retrieved element.

Num.name: Num
Num.description: The Num node returns the number of elements in the given array.

inputs.name: Array
inputs.description: The array whose elements will be counted.

outputs.name: Num
outputs.description: The number of elements in the given array.

Random Get.name: Random Get
Random Get.description: The Random Get node randomly retrieves elements from an input array. Optionally, an array of weights can be supplied to adjust the randomness.

inputs.name: Next
inputs.description: The trigger on which to get the next random value in the array.

inputs.name: Reset
inputs.description: The trigger on which to reset the randomization seed for the array.

inputs.name: In Array
inputs.description: The input array from which to randomly retrieve elements.

inputs.name: Weights
inputs.description: (Optional) An input array of weights used to define the probability of each entry retrieved. If not provided, an even probability for all elements is assumed. If this array is shorter than the input array, it is repeated to match the size.

inputs.name: Seed
inputs.description: The seed used for the random shuffle. The default value of -1 will use the current time.

inputs.name: No Repeats
inputs.description: The number of elements to track to avoid repeating in a row. For example, a value of 2 prevents this node from repeating the last two selected elements.

inputs.name: Enabled Shared State
inputs.description: If enabled, this node's state is shared across instances of this MetaSound to avoid playing the same exact variations at the same time.

outputs.name: On Next
outputs.description: Triggers when the Next input is triggered.

outputs.name: On Reset
outputs.description: Triggers when the Shuffle input is triggered or if the array is auto-shuffled.

outputs.name: Value
outputs.description: The randomly-selected value from the input array.

Set.name: Set
Set.description: The Set node sets the value of a specified index in a given array.

inputs.name: Trigger
inputs.description: The trigger on which to set value in the array.

inputs.name: Array
inputs.description: The array in which a value will be set.

inputs.name: Index
inputs.description: The index to set in the target array.

inputs.name: Value
inputs.description: The value to which the selected index is set.

outputs.name: Array
outputs.description: The array after the setting operation is completed.

Shuffle.name: Shuffle
Shuffle.description: The Shuffle node outputs elements from a shuffled array.

inputs.name: Next
inputs.description: The trigger on which to get the next value in the shuffled array.

inputs.name: Shuffle
inputs.description: The trigger on which to shuffle the array manually.

inputs.name: Reset Seed
inputs.description: The trigger on which to reset the random seed stream.

inputs.name: In Array
inputs.description: The array from which to shuffle and output elements.

inputs.name: Seed
inputs.description: The seed used for the random shuffle. The default value of -1 uses the current time.

inputs.name: Auto Shuffle
inputs.description: If enabled, automatically shuffles when the array has been read completely.

inputs.name: Enabled Shared State
inputs.description: If enabled, the state is shared across instances of this MetaSound.

outputs.name: On Next
outputs.description: Triggers when the Next input is triggered.

outputs.name: On Shuffle
outputs.description: Triggers when the Shuffle input is triggered or if the array is auto-shuffled.

outputs.name: On Reset Seed
outputs.description: Triggers when the Reset Seed input is triggered.

outputs.name: Value
outputs.description: The value of the currently-selected element.

Subset.name: Subset
Subset.description: The Subset node returns a subset of an input array.

inputs.name: Trigger
inputs.description: The trigger on which to generate a subset.

inputs.name: Array
inputs.description: The input array from which to get a subset.

inputs.name: Start / End Index
inputs.description: The first and last indices to include in the subset.

outputs.name: Array
outputs.description: The subset of the input array.

Get Wave Info.name: Get Wave Info
Get Wave Info.description: The Get Wave Info node returns the info from the Wave Asset.

inputs.name: Wave
inputs.description: The input Wave Asset.

outputs.name: Duration
outputs.description: The duration of the Wave Asset (in seconds).

outputs.name: Path
outputs.description: The full path of the Wave Asset.

Print Log.name: Print Log
Print Log.description: The Print Log node is used to record values to the Output Log on a given trigger for debugging purposes. There are multiple versions of this node in order to support several common data types, including: Bool, Float, Int32, and String.

inputs.name: Trigger
inputs.description: The trigger on which to write the set value to the log.

inputs.name: Label
inputs.description: The label to attach to the value logged.

inputs.name: Value To Log
inputs.description: The value to record to the log when triggered.

Delay.name: Delay
Delay.description: The Delay node provides a mono buffer delay that supports dry level, wet level, and feedback. For multi-channel buffer delay, use the Stereo Delay node.

inputs.name: In
inputs.description: The audio signal to apply delay to.

inputs.name: Delay Time
inputs.description: The amount of time to delay the audio (in seconds).

inputs.name: Dry Level
inputs.description: The level for the unprocessed (dry) signal

inputs.name: Wet Level
inputs.description: The level for the processed (wet) signal.

inputs.name: Feedback
inputs.description: The amount of feedback to use.

inputs.name: Max Delay Time
inputs.description: The amount of feedback to use.

outputs.name: Out
outputs.description: The delayed audio signal.

Delay Pitch Shift.name: Delay Pitch Shift
Delay Pitch Shift.description: The Delay Pitch Shift node pitch shifts the audio buffer using a delay-based doppler-shift method. This allows for pitch shifting without changing the length of the audio file by using an internal delay buffer. The pitch will shift but the sound will not speed up or slow down.

inputs.name: In
inputs.description: The audio buffer to process.

inputs.name: Pitch Shift
inputs.description: The amount of pitch shift (in semitones) to apply.

inputs.name: Delay Length
inputs.description: The amount of delay (between 10 and 100 milliseconds) to apply. Changing this value can reduce artifacts in certain pitch shift regions.

outputs.name: Out
outputs.description: The processed audio buffer.

Diffuser.name: Diffuser
Diffuser.description: The Diffuser node applies diffusion to the incoming audio.

inputs.name: Input Audio
inputs.description: The audio to apply diffusion to.

inputs.name: Depth
inputs.description: The number of filters to use to diffuse the audio (between 1 and 5). This will not update while running.

inputs.name: Feedback
inputs.description: The amount of feedback to use on each diffuser (between 0 and 1).

outputs.name: Output Audio
outputs.description: The diffused audio.

Grain Delay.name: Grain Delay
Grain Delay.description: The Grain Delay node performs delayed audio granulation on a given audio buffer by sampling it into "grains" and playing them after a set delay.

inputs.name: In Audio
inputs.description: The audio buffer to be grain delayed.

inputs.name: Grain Spawn
inputs.description: The trigger on which to spawn a new grain of audio.

inputs.name: Grain Delay
inputs.description: The delay (in milliseconds, between 0 and 2000) of the next spawned grain.

inputs.name: Grain Delay Range
inputs.description: The range delta (in milliseconds) used to randomize the delay in relation to the central Grain Delay value.

inputs.name: Grain Duration
inputs.description: The duration (in milliseconds) of the next spawned grain.

inputs.name: Grain Duration Range
inputs.description: The range delta (in milliseconds) used to randomize the duration in relation to the central Grain Duration value.

inputs.name: Pitch Shift
inputs.description: The pitch value (in semitones) to change the grain pitch of all rendering grains.

inputs.name: Pitch Shift Range
inputs.description: The pitch shift delta (in semitones) used to randomize the pitch shift in relation to the central Pitch Shift value.

inputs.name: Grain Envelope
inputs.description: The type of envelope to use for the grains: Gaussian, Triangle, Downward Triangle, Upward Triangle, Exponential Decay, or Exponential Attack

inputs.name: Max Grain Count
inputs.description: The maximum number of grains to render at a time (between 1 and 100).

inputs.name: Feedback Amount
inputs.description: The amount of feedback of each grain. If feedback is applied, the grain delay will feed its audio output back into itself.

outputs.name: Out Audio
outputs.description: The grain-delayed audio buffer.

Stereo Delay.name: Stereo Delay
Stereo Delay.description: The Stereo Delay node provides multi-channel buffer delay. Like the Delay node, which provides mono buffer delay, this node supports dry level, wet level, and feedback, but also supports additional delay modes.

inputs.name: In Left / Right
inputs.description: The input audio signals (left / right channels) to apply delay to.

inputs.name: Delay Mode
inputs.description:
The delay method to use:

  Normal: The left input mixes with the left delay output and feeds to the left output.
  Cross: The left input mixes with the right delay output and feeds to the right output.
  Ping Pong: The left input mixes with the left delay output and feeds to the right output.

inputs.name: Delay Time
inputs.description: The amount of time to delay the audio (in seconds).

inputs.name: Delay Ratio
inputs.description: The ratio of delay to apply to the left and right channels. This means channels can have different delay amounts. For example, a value of -1 applies no delay to the left channel while fully delaying the right channel, which can be useful for stereo channel decorrelation.

inputs.name: Dry Level
inputs.description: The level for the unprocessed (dry) signal

inputs.name: Wet Level
inputs.description: The level for the processed (wet) signal.

inputs.name: Feedback
inputs.description: The amount of feedback to use.

outputs.name: Out Left / Right
outputs.description: The output audio signal (left / right channels).

Compressor.name: Compressor
Compressor.description: The Compressor node lowers the dynamic range of an input audio signal.

inputs.name: Audio
inputs.description: The audio signal to compress.

inputs.name: Ratio
inputs.description: The ratio of gain reduction to apply. For example, a value of 1 produces no gain reduction and a value greater than 1 produces gain reduction.

inputs.name: Threshold dB
inputs.description: The amplitude threshold (in decibels) above which gain will be reduced.

inputs.name: Attack Time
inputs.description: The amount of time it takes for audio above the Threshold (dB) to reach its compressed volume level.

inputs.name: Release Time
inputs.description: The amount of time it takes for audio below the Threshold (dB) to return to its original volume level.

inputs.name: Lookahead Time
inputs.description: The amount of time it takes to delay the compressed signal behind the analyzed input signal.

inputs.name: Knee
inputs.description: A decibel value that determines how hard or soft the gain reduction blends. A value of 0 dB provides no blending.

inputs.name: Sidechain
inputs.description: (Optional) An external audio signal to control the compressor with. If unset, the input audio signal is used.

inputs.name: Envelope Mode
inputs.description:
The envelope-following method the compressor will use for gain detection:

  MS: Envelope follows a running Mean Squared of the audio signal.
  RMS: Envelope follows a running Root Meat Squared of the audio signal.
  Peak: Envelope follows the peaks in the audio signal.

inputs.name: Analog Mode
inputs.description: If enabled, use Analog Mode for the compressor's envelope follower.

inputs.name: Upwards Mode
inputs.description: If enabled, an upwards compressor is used instead of the standard downwards compressor.

inputs.name: Wet/Dry
inputs.description: The ratio between the processed (wet) and the unprocessed (dry) signal. For example, a value of 0 is fully dry and a value of 1 is fully wet.

outputs.name: Audio
outputs.description: The output audio signal with the compressor effect applied.

outputs.name: Gain Envelope
outputs.description: The amount of gain applied to the signal.

Decibels to Linear Gain.name: Decibels to Linear Gain
Decibels to Linear Gain.description: The Decibels to Linear Gain node converts a logarithmic (dB) gain value to a linear gain value.

inputs.name: Decibels
inputs.description: The input logarithmic (dB) gain value.

outputs.name: Linear Gain
outputs.description: The output linear gain value.

Limiter.name: Limiter
Limiter.description: The Limiter node prevents a signal from going above a given threshold.

inputs.name: Audio
inputs.description: The input audio signal to be limited.

inputs.name: Input Gain dB
inputs.description: The amount of gain (in decibels) to apply to the input before limiting.

inputs.name: Threshold dB
inputs.description: The amplitude threshold (in decibels) above which gain will be reduced.

inputs.name: Release Time
inputs.description: The time it takes for audio below the threshold to return to its original volume level.

inputs.name: Knee
inputs.description: The knee mode determines if the gain reduction blends are Hard or Soft.

outputs.name: Audio
outputs.description: The limited audio signal.

Linear Gain to Decibels.name: Linear Gain to Decibels
Linear Gain to Decibels.description: The Linear Gain to Decibels node converts a linear gain value to a logarithmic (dB) gain value.

inputs.name: Linear Gain
inputs.description: The input linear gain value.

outputs.name: Decibels
outputs.description: The output logarithmic (dB) gain value.

AD Envelope.name: AD Envelope
AD Envelope.description: The AD Envelope node generates an attack-decay envelope value output when triggered.

inputs.name: Trigger
inputs.description: The trigger on which to start the attack phase of the envelope generator.

inputs.name: Attack Time
inputs.description: The amount of time (in seconds) to reach the maximum envelope value (1.0).

inputs.name: Delay Time
inputs.description: The amount of time (in seconds) to reach the minimum envelope value (0.0).

inputs.name: Attack Curve
inputs.description: The exponential curve factor of the attack phase. For example, a value of 1.0 produces linear growth, a value less than 1.0 produces logarithmic growth, and a value greater than 1.0 produces exponential growth.

inputs.name: Decay Curve
inputs.description: The exponential curve factor of the decay phase. For example, a value of 1.0 produces linear decay, a value greater than 1.0 produces logarithmic decay, and a value less than 1.0 produces exponential decay.

inputs.name: Looping
inputs.description: If enabled, the envelope will loop.

outputs.name: On Trigger
outputs.description: Triggers when the envelope is triggered.

outputs.name: On Done
outputs.description: Triggers when the envelope finishes or loops back if looping is enabled.

outputs.name: Out Envelope
outputs.description: The output value of the envelope.

ADSR Envelope.name: ADSR Envelope
ADSR Envelope.description: The ADSR Envelope node generates an attack-decay-sustain-release envelope value output when triggered. This node is similar to the AD Envelope node, but it requires a separate release trigger for the release phase of the envelope to begin.

inputs.name: Trigger Attack
inputs.description: The trigger on which to start the attack phase of the envelope generator.

inputs.name: Trigger Release
inputs.description: The trigger on which to start the release phase of the envelope generator.

inputs.name: Attack Time
inputs.description: The amount of time (in seconds) to reach the maximum envelope value (1.0).

inputs.name: Delay Time
inputs.description: The amount of time (in seconds) to reach the minimum envelope value (0.0).

inputs.name: Sustain Level
inputs.description: The sustain level of the envelope.

inputs.name: Release Time
inputs.description: The release time of the envelope.

inputs.name: Attack Curve
inputs.description: The exponential curve factor of the attack phase. For example, a value of 1.0 produces linear growth, a value less than 1.0 produces logarithmic growth, and a value greater than 1.0 produces exponential growth.

inputs.name: Decay Curve
inputs.description: The exponential curve factor of the decay phase. For example, a value of 1.0 produces linear decay, a value greater than 1.0 produces logarithmic decay, and a value less than 1.0 produces exponential decay.

inputs.name: Release Curve
inputs.description: The exponential curve factor of the release phase. For example, a value of 1.0 produces linear release, a value greater than 1.0 produces logarithmic release, and a value less than 1.0 produces exponential release.

outputs.name: On Attack Triggered
outputs.description: Triggers when the envelope attack phase is triggered.

outputs.name: On Decay Triggered
outputs.description: Triggers when the envelope decay phase is triggered.

outputs.name: On Sustain Triggered
outputs.description: Triggers when the envelope sustain phase is triggered.

outputs.name: On Release Triggered
outputs.description: Triggers when the envelope release phase is triggered.

outputs.name: On Done
outputs.description: Triggers when the envelope is finished.

outputs.name: Out Envelope
outputs.description: The output value of the envelope.

Crossfade.name: Crossfade
Crossfade.description: The Crossfade node blends between inputs linearly using a provided block-rate float parameter. There are multiple versions of this node to support different input counts (between 2 and 8).

inputs.name: Crossfade Value
inputs.description: The value which represents the current blend between the provided inputs. For example, a value of 0.5 for input values of 2 and 4 will result in an output of 3.

inputs.name: In X
inputs.description: The input corresponding with position X.

outputs.name: Out
outputs.description: The value produced from the crossfade.

Evaluate WaveTable.name: Evaluate WaveTable
Evaluate WaveTable.description: The Evaluate WaveTable node outputs the value of a WaveTable at a given input phase, allowing you to use the WaveTable as a curve in the graph.

inputs.name: WaveTable
inputs.description: The WaveTable to evaluate.

inputs.name: Interpolation
inputs.description: The method to use to interpolate between WaveTable values: None (Step), Linear, or Cubic

WaveTable Envelope.name: WaveTable Envelope
WaveTable Envelope.description: The WaveTable Envelope node reads through the given WaveTable over the given duration.

inputs.name: WaveTable
inputs.description: The WaveTable to read.

inputs.name: Play
inputs.description: The trigger on which to play the envelope.

inputs.name: Stop
inputs.description: The trigger on which to stop the envelope.

inputs.name: Pause
inputs.description: The trigger on which to pause the envelope.

inputs.name: Duration
inputs.description: The duration (in seconds).

inputs.name: Mode
inputs.description:
Determines what value the envelope completes on and if it loops:

  Loop: Interpolates the last and first values in the WaveTable and restarts interpolation of the envelope on completion.
  Hold: Holds the last value in the table if playback elapses beyond the WaveTable's length.
  Unit: Interpolates the last value in the table with 1.0 if playback elapses beyond the WaveTable's length.
  Zero: Interpolates the last value in the table with 0.0 if playback elapses beyond the WaveTable's length.

inputs.name: Interpolation
inputs.description:
Determines how the envelope interpolates between WaveTable values:

  None (Step): No interpolation between values. The lowest value is used.
  Linear: Linearly interpolates between values.
  Cubic: Cubically interpolates between values.

outputs.name: OnFinished
outputs.description: Triggers when the envelope is finished.

outputs.name: Out
outputs.description: The output value.

Audio Bus Reader.name: Audio Bus Reader
Audio Bus Reader.description: The Audio Bus Reader node outputs audio data from an Audio Bus asset. There are two versions of this node to support different channel amounts (either 1 or 2).

inputs.name: Audio Bus
inputs.description: The Audio Bus asset to read data from.

outputs.name: Out X
outputs.description: The audio output for channel X.

Wave Writer.name: Wave Writer
Wave Writer.description: The Wave Writer node writes audio signals to disk. There are multiple versions of this node to support different channel amounts (between 1 and 8).

inputs.name: Filename Prefix
inputs.description: The filename prefix used for the output file.

inputs.name: Enabled
inputs.description: If enabled, this node will write audio signals to disk.

inputs.name: In X
inputs.description: The audio input corresponding with channel X.

Biquad Filter.name: Biquad Filter
Biquad Filter.description: The Biquad Filter node provides a simple two-pole biquad filter that supports a variety of configurations.

inputs.name: In
inputs.description: The audio to be biquad filtered.

inputs.name: Cutoff Frequency
inputs.description: The value of the cutoff frequency.

inputs.name: Bandwidth
inputs.description: When applicable, controls the bandwidth value of the current filter type.

inputs.name: Gain (dB)
inputs.description: The gain (in decibels) applied to the band when in Parametric mode.

outputs.name: Out
outputs.description: The biquad-filtered audio.

Bitcrusher.name: Bitcrusher
Bitcrusher.description: The Bitcrusher node downsamples and lowers the bit-depth of an incoming audio signal.

inputs.name: Audio
inputs.description: The audio signal to bitcrush.

inputs.name: Sample Rate
inputs.description: The sampling frequency to downsample the audio to.

inputs.name: Bit Depth
inputs.description: The bit resolution to reduce the audio to.

outputs.name: Audio
outputs.description: The bitcrushed audio signal.

Dynamic Filter.name: Dynamic Filter
Dynamic Filter.description: The Dynamic Filter node filters a band of audio based on the strength of the input signal.

inputs.name: Audio
inputs.description: The audio signal to filter.

inputs.name: Sidechain
inputs.description: (Optional) An external audio signal to control the filter with. If not set, the input audio signal is used.

inputs.name: FilterType
inputs.description: The filter shape to use: Bell, Low Shelf, or High Shelf

inputs.name: Frequency
inputs.description: The center frequency of the filter.

inputs.name: Q
inputs.description: The filter's Q, or resonance, which controls the steepness of the filter.

inputs.name: Threshold dB
inputs.description: The amplitude threshold (dB) above which gain is reduced.

inputs.name: Ratio
inputs.description: The amount of gain reduction to apply. A value of 1 applies no reduction and a higher value provides more reduction.

inputs.name: Knee
inputs.description: A decibel value that determines how hard or soft the gain reduction blends. A value of 0 dB provides no blending.

inputs.name: Range
inputs.description: The maximum gain reduction allowed (in decibels). A negative value applies compression and a positive value flips it into an expander.

inputs.name: Gain (dB)
inputs.description: The amount of make-up gain (in decibels) to apply.

inputs.name: AttackTime
inputs.description: The amount of time (in seconds) it takes the audio above the threshold to reach its compressed volume level.

inputs.name: ReleaseTime
inputs.description: The amount of time (in seconds) it takes for the audio below the threshold to return to its original volume level.

inputs.name: EnvelopeMode
inputs.description: The envelope-following method the compressor uses for gain detection.

inputs.name: AnalogMode
inputs.description: If enabled, analog mode is used for the compressor's envelope follower.

outputs.name: Audio
outputs.description: The filtered audio signal.

Ladder Filter.name: Ladder Filter
Ladder Filter.description: The Ladder Filter node provides a virtual analog filter that has a pleasing and classic rolloff and resonance.

inputs.name: In
inputs.description: The audio to be processed by the ladder filter.

inputs.name: Cutoff Frequency
inputs.description: The value of the cutoff frequency.

inputs.name: Resonance
inputs.description: The value of the filter resonance.

outputs.name: Out
outputs.description: The ladder filtered audio.

Mono Band Splitter.name: Mono Band Splitter
Mono Band Splitter.description: The Mono Band Splitter node splits incoming audio into separate frequency bands. There are multiple versions of this node to support different input and output counts (between 2 and 5).

inputs.name: In
inputs.description: The base audio input channel.

inputs.name: Filter Order
inputs.description: The steepness of the crossover filters: Two Pole, Four Pole, Six Pole, or Eight Pole

inputs.name: Phase Compensate
inputs.description: If enabled, each band is phase-compensated so they can be summed back together correctly.

inputs.name: Crossover X
inputs.description: The frequency of the crossover filters from Band X to the next.

outputs.name: Band X Out
outputs.description: The audio output corresponding to channel X.

One-Pole High Pass Filter.name: One-Pole High Pass Filter
One-Pole High Pass Filter.description: The One-Pole High Pass Filter node is a computationally cheap filter useful for a number of simple applications, such as simulating occlusion.

inputs.name: In
inputs.description: The audio signal to be filtered.

inputs.name: Cutoff Frequency
inputs.description: The value of the cutoff frequency.

outputs.name: Out
outputs.description: The filtered audio signal.

One-Pole Low Pass Filter.name: One-Pole Low Pass Filter
One-Pole Low Pass Filter.description: The One-Pole Low Pass Filter node is a computationally cheap filter useful for a number of simple applications, such as simulating air absorption

inputs.name: In
inputs.description: The audio signal to be filtered.

inputs.name: Cutoff Frequency
inputs.description: The value of the cutoff frequency.

outputs.name: Out
outputs.description: The filtered audio signal.

Sample And Hold.name: Sample And Hold
Sample And Hold.description: The Sample And Hold node outputs a single value of the input audio signal when triggered.

inputs.name: Sample And Hold
inputs.description: The trigger on which to sample and hold the input audio.

inputs.name: In
inputs.description: The audio signal to sample.

outputs.name: On Sample And Hold
outputs.description: Triggers when the Sample and Hold input is triggered.

outputs.name: Out
outputs.description: The sampled audio signal.

State Variable Filter.name: State Variable Filter
State Variable Filter.description: The State Variable Filter node provides a virtual analog filter used in many synthesis applications.

inputs.name: In
inputs.description: The audio to be processed by the filter.

inputs.name: Cutoff Frequency
inputs.description: The value of the cutoff frequency.

inputs.name: Resonance
inputs.description: The value of the filter resonance.

inputs.name: Band Stop Control
inputs.description: The control value applied to the band stop output.

outputs.name: Low Pass Filter
outputs.description: The low pass filter output.

outputs.name: High Pass Filter
outputs.description: The high pass filter output.

outputs.name: Band Pass
outputs.description: The band pass filter output.

outputs.name: Band Stop
outputs.description: The band stop filter output.

Stereo Band Splitter.name: Stereo Band Splitter
Stereo Band Splitter.description: The Stereo Band Splitter node splits incoming audio into separate frequency bands. There are multiple versions of this node to support different input and output counts (between 2 and 5).

inputs.name: In L / R
inputs.description: The base audio input channels.

inputs.name: Filter Order
inputs.description: The steepness of the crossover filters: Two Pole, Four Pole, Six Pole, Eight Pole

inputs.name: Phase Compensate
inputs.description: If enabled, each band is phase-compensated so that they can be summed back together correctly.

inputs.name: Crossover X
inputs.description: The frequency of the crossover filters from Band X to the next.

outputs.name: Band X L / R
outputs.description: The audio output corresponding to channel X (in the left / right channel).

Additive Synth.name: Additive Synth
Additive Synth.description: The Additive Synth node synthesizes audio by adding given sinusoids together.

inputs.name: Base Frequency
inputs.description: The sinusoid frequency the harmonics are based on. The value is clamped from 0.0 to the Nyquist frequency.

inputs.name: HarmonicMultipliers
inputs.description: An array of harmonic multipliers applied to the base frequency. The number of sinusoids used depends on the size of this array. The values are clamped from 0.0 to a maximum so the resulting frequency won't go above the Nyquist frequency.

inputs.name: Amplitudes
inputs.description: The array of sinusoid amplitudes. The values are clamped to a range of 0.0 to 1.0

inputs.name: Phases
inputs.description: The array of sinusoid phases (in degrees). The values are clamped to a range of 0.0 to 360.

inputs.name: Pan Amounts
inputs.description: The array of pan amounts (using equal power law). For example, a value of -1.0 is fully left and a value of 1.0 is fully right.

outputs.name: Out Left / Right Audio
outputs.description: The synthesized audio output (left / right channels).

Low Frequency Noise.name: Low Frequency Noise
Low Frequency Noise.description: The Low Frequency Noise node produces random values at a set frequency and smoothly interpolates between them to add periodic variation to a signal.

inputs.name: Rate
inputs.description: The rate (Hz) of each new value. This is clamped to block rate.

inputs.name: Seed
inputs.description: The seed used for the random shuffle. The default value of -1 uses the current time.

inputs.name: Reset Seed
inputs.description: The trigger on which to reset the seed.

inputs.name: Sync
inputs.description: The trigger on which to reset the phase of the generator.

inputs.name: Interpolation
inputs.description: The method to use to interpolate between values: None, Linear, or Cubic

inputs.name: Rate Jitter
inputs.description: A percentage to randomly modify (+/-) the Rate by. This value is clamped between 0.0 and 1.0.

inputs.name: Step Limit
inputs.description: A percentage to limit the next random number in sequence to. This value is clamped between 0.0 and 1.0.

inputs.name: Min Value
inputs.description: The minimum output value.

inputs.name: Max Value
inputs.description: The maximum output value.

outputs.name: Out
outputs.description: The scaled output based on the Min Value and Max Value.

outputs.name: Normalized
outputs.description: The normalized output.

Low-Frequency Oscillator (LFO).name: Low-Frequency Oscillator (LFO)
Low-Frequency Oscillator (LFO).description: The LFO node provides a low-frequency oscillator which you can use to create a variety of audio effects, such as phasing, vibrato, and tremolo.

inputs.name: Frequency
inputs.description: The frequency (Hz) of the LFO (clamped at block rate).

inputs.name: Shape
inputs.description: The wave shape of the LFO: Sine, Saw, Triangle, or Square

inputs.name: Min / Max Value
inputs.description: The minimum / maximum output values.

inputs.name: Sync
inputs.description: Resets the phase of the generator. You can use this in conjunction with other nodes to get audio-rate phase synced generators.

inputs.name: Phase Offset
inputs.description: The phase offset (in degrees, between 0 and 360).

inputs.name: Pulse Width
inputs.description: The pulse width (between 0 and 1).

outputs.name: Out
outputs.description: The output value of the LFO (clamped at block rate).

Noise.name: Noise
Noise.description: The Noise node generates either pink or white noise.

inputs.name: Seed
inputs.description: The seed for the random number generator. The default value of -1 uses the current time.

outputs.name: Audio
outputs.description: The generated noise output.

Perlin Noise.name: Perlin Noise
Perlin Noise.description: The Perlin Noise node evaluates one-dimensional Perlin value noise to add natural roughness to a signal. This node has two versions to support different data types (Audio or Float).

inputs.name: X
inputs.description: The input value to the Perlin function. By default, the internal clock (in seconds) will be used.

inputs.name: Layers
inputs.description: The number of octaves of noise to sum.

inputs.name: Seed
inputs.description: The seed used for the random shuffle. The default value of -1 uses the current time.

inputs.name: Min Value
inputs.description: The minimum output value.

inputs.name: Max Value
inputs.description: The maximum output value.

outputs.name: Normalized
outputs.description: The normalized output.

Saw.name: Saw
Saw.description: The Saw node emits an audio signal of a saw wave with the given properties.

inputs.name: Enabled
inputs.description: If enabled, the oscillator produces a signal.

inputs.name: Bi Polar
inputs.description: If enabled, the output is bi-polar (-1, 1). Otherwise, the output is uni-polar (0, 1).

inputs.name: Frequency
inputs.description: The base frequency of the oscillator (in Hz).

inputs.name: Modulation
inputs.description: An audio-rate input to modulate the base frequency.

inputs.name: Sync
inputs.description: Resets the phase of the generator. You can use this in conjunction with other nodes to get audio-rate phase synced generators.

inputs.name: Phase Offset
inputs.description: The phase offset (in degrees, between 0 and 360).

inputs.name: Glide
inputs.description: The amount of glide (smooth interpolation over time) used when changing frequencies. For example, a value of 0.0 will produce no glide and a value of 1.0 produces lots of glide.

outputs.name: Audio
outputs.description: The saw wave audio signal.

Sine.name: Sine
Sine.description: The Sine node emits an audio signal of a sinusoid with the given properties.

inputs.name: Enabled
inputs.description: If enabled, the oscillator produces a signal.

inputs.name: Bi Polar
inputs.description: If enabled, the output is bi-polar (-1, 1). Otherwise, the output is uni-polar (0, 1).

inputs.name: Frequency
inputs.description: The base frequency of the oscillator (in Hz).

inputs.name: Modulation
inputs.description: An audio-rate input to modulate the base frequency.

inputs.name: Sync
inputs.description: Resets the phase of the generator. You can use this in conjunction with other nodes to get audio-rate phase synced generators.

inputs.name: Phase Offset
inputs.description: The phase offset (in degrees, between 0 and 360).

inputs.name: Glide
inputs.description: The amount of glide (smooth interpolation over time) used when changing frequencies. For example, a value of 0.0 will produce no glide and a value of 1.0 produces lots of glide.

outputs.name: Audio
outputs.description: The sinusoid audio signal.

Square.name: Square
Square.description: The Square node emits an audio signal of a square wave with the given properties.

inputs.name: Enabled
inputs.description: If enabled, the oscillator produces a signal.

inputs.name: Bi Polar
inputs.description: If enabled, the output is bi-polar (-1, 1). Otherwise, the output is uni-polar (0, 1).

inputs.name: Frequency
inputs.description: The base frequency of the oscillator (in Hz).

inputs.name: Modulation
inputs.description: An audio-rate input to modulate the base frequency.

inputs.name: Sync
inputs.description: Resets the phase of the generator. You can use this in conjunction with other nodes to get audio-rate phase synced generators.

inputs.name: Phase Offset
inputs.description: The phase offset (in degrees, between 0 and 360).

inputs.name: Glide
inputs.description: The amount of glide (smooth interpolation over time) used when changing frequencies. For example, a value of 0.0 will produce no glide and a value of 1.0 produces lots of glide.

inputs.name: Pulse Width
inputs.description: The relative pulse width of the square wave.

outputs.name: Audio
outputs.description: The square wave audio signal.

SuperOscillator.name: SuperOscillator
SuperOscillator.description: The SuperOscillator node generates audio using multiple internal oscillators. You can detune each internal oscillator evenly or randomly using Detune and Entropy. It supports all of the features of basic oscillator nodes, with the addition of a built-in limiter to keep the amplitude in check when there are higher voice counts. This node has two versions to support different channel configurations (Stereo or Mono).

inputs.name: Enabled
inputs.description: If enabled, the oscillator produces a signal.

inputs.name: Limit Output
inputs.description: If enabled, the output volume will be limited.

inputs.name: Voices
inputs.description: The number of oscillators to use. This value is clamped between 1 and 16.

inputs.name: Frequency
inputs.description: The base frequency (Hz) of the oscillator.

inputs.name: Modulation
inputs.description: The modulation frequency.

inputs.name: Detune
inputs.description: The max pitch offset (in semitones). Only oscillators beyond the 2nd are detuned.

inputs.name: Entropy
inputs.description: This value controls how evenly the voices are distributed in pitch. This value is clamped between 0.0 and 1.0.

inputs.name: Blend
inputs.description: The volume (dB) of detuned voices relative to the primary voice.

inputs.name: Glide
inputs.description: The amount of glide (smooth interpolation over time) used when changing frequencies. For example, a value of 0.0 will produce no glide and a value of 1.0 produces lots of glide.

inputs.name: Pulse Width
inputs.description: The width of the square segment of the wave. This is only used for Square waves.

inputs.name: Width
inputs.description: The stereo width of the oscillators. This value is clamped between 0.0 and 1.0.

outputs.name: Audio
outputs.description: The output audio signal.

Triangle.name: Triangle
Triangle.description: The Triangle node emits an audio signal of a triangle wave with the given properties.

inputs.name: Enabled
inputs.description: If enabled, the oscillator produces a signal.

inputs.name: Bi Polar
inputs.description: If enabled, the output will be bi-polar (-1, 1). Otherwise, the output will be uni-polar (0, 1).

inputs.name: Frequency
inputs.description: The base frequency of the oscillator (in Hz).

inputs.name: Modulation
inputs.description: An audio-rate input to modulate the base frequency.

inputs.name: Sync
inputs.description: Resets the phase of the generator. You can use this in conjunction with other nodes to get audio-rate phase synced generators.

inputs.name: Phase Offset
inputs.description: The phase offset (in degrees, between 0 and 360).

inputs.name: Glide
inputs.description: The amount of glide (smooth interpolation over time) used when changing frequencies. For example, a value of 0.0 will produce no glide and a value of 1.0 produces lots of glide.

outputs.name: Audio
outputs.description: The triangle wave audio signal.

WaveTable Oscillator.name: WaveTable Oscillator
WaveTable Oscillator.description: The WaveTable Oscillator node reads through the given WaveTable at the provided frequency.

inputs.name: Play
inputs.description: The trigger on which to play the oscillator (block rate).

inputs.name: Stop
inputs.description: The trigger on which to stop the oscillator (block rate).

inputs.name: WaveTable
inputs.description: The WaveTable to read.

inputs.name: Freq
inputs.description: The number of times to sample one period of the WaveTable per second. This frequency should be set between -20000 Hz and 20000 Hz.

inputs.name: Sync
inputs.description: The trigger on which to restart playback of the WaveTable on the trigger boundary (sample rate).

inputs.name: Phase Modulator
inputs.description: The audio source to be used for the modulating oscillation phase of the provided WaveTable. A value of 0 produces no phase modulation and a value of 1 produces a full table length (360 degrees) of phase shift.

outputs.name: Out
outputs.description: The output audio buffer.

WaveTable Player.name: WaveTable Player
WaveTable Player.description: The WaveTable Player node reads through a WaveTable Bank entry at a given index.

inputs.name: Play
inputs.description: The trigger on which to play the oscillator (block rate).

inputs.name: Stop
inputs.description: The trigger on which to stop the oscillator (block rate).

inputs.name: Sync
inputs.description: The trigger on which to restart playback of the WaveTable on the trigger boundary (sample rate).

inputs.name: Bank
inputs.description: The WaveTable Bank to play from.

inputs.name: Index
inputs.description: The index of the WaveTable in the WaveTable Bank to play.

inputs.name: Pitch Shift
inputs.description: How much to shift the pitch of the given WaveTable.

inputs.name: Loop
inputs.description: If enabled, the WaveTable will loop.

outputs.name: Mono Out
outputs.description: The output audio buffer (in mono).

outputs.name: On Finished
outputs.description: Triggers when the WaveTable Player finishes playing the WaveTable.

Abs.name: Abs
Abs.description: The Abs node returns the absolute value of a given input. For example, an input value of -2.0 will output 2.0. This node has different versions which support several common data types, including: Audio, Float, Int32, and Time.

Add.name: Add
Add.description: The Add node performs addition operations on provided inputs. This node has different versions which support several common data types, including: Audio, Float to Audio, Float, Int32, and Time.

Clamp.name: Clamp
Clamp.description: The Clamp node returns the clamped value of the input within the given value range. This node has different versions which support several common data types, including: Audio, Float, and Int32.

inputs.name: In
inputs.description: The input value to clamp.

inputs.name: Min / Max
inputs.description: The min / max value to clamp the input value to.

outputs.name: Value
outputs.description: The clamped value.

Divide.name: Divide
Divide.description: The Divide node performs division operations on provided inputs. This node has different versions which support several common data types, including: Float, Int32, and Time by Float.

Filter Q To Bandwidth.name: Filter Q To Bandwidth
Filter Q To Bandwidth.description: The Filter Q To Bandwidth node converts a given Q (quality-factor) parameter for filter control to a bandwidth value.

Linear To Log Frequency.name: Linear To Log Frequency
Linear To Log Frequency.description: The Linear To Log Frequency node converts a linear space input value to a log-frequency output.

inputs.name: Value
inputs.description: The linear input value to map to a log frequency output.

inputs.name: Min / Max Domain
inputs.description: The min / max domain for the input value. The input and output values are clamped to this domain.

inputs.name: Min / Max Range
inputs.description: The min / max positive range for the output frequency (Hz) value. The input and output values are clamped to this range.

outputs.name: Frequency
outputs.description: The output frequency (Hz) that is the log frequency of the input value.

Log.name: Log
Log.description: The Log node calculates the float-base logarithm of another float.

Map Range.name: Map Range
Map Range.description: The Map Range node maps an input value in a given input range to a given output range. The results can also be clamped. This node has different versions which support several common data types, including: Audio, Float, and Int32. These nodes are analogous to the Blueprint Map Range nodes.

inputs.name: In
inputs.description: The input value to map.

inputs.name: In Range A / B
inputs.description: The minimum and maximum input value range.

inputs.name: Out Range A / B
inputs.description: The minimum and maximum output value range.

inputs.name: Clamped
inputs.description: If enabled, the input will be clamped to the specified input range.

outputs.name: Out Value
outputs.description: The mapped output value.

Max.name: Max
Max.description: The Max node returns the higher value (max) of A and B. This node has different versions to support several common data types, including: Audio, Float, and Int32.

inputs.name: A / B
inputs.description: The input values to compare.

outputs.name: Value
outputs.description: The higher value (max) of A and B.

Min.name: Min
Min.description: The Min node returns the lower value (min) of A and B. This node has different versions which support several common data types, including: Audio, Float, and Int32.

inputs.name: A / B
inputs.description: The input values to compare.

outputs.name: Value
outputs.description: The lower value (min) of A and B.

Modulo.name: Modulo
Modulo.description: The Modulo node returns the remainder of a division operation of two given Int32 values.

Multiply.name: Multiply
Multiply.description: The Multiply node performs multiplication operations on provided inputs. This node has different versions which support several common data types, including: Audio by Float, Audio, Float, Int32, and Time by Float.

Power.name: Power
Power.description: The Power node raises a given Float to the power of another Float.

Subtract.name: Subtract
Subtract.description: The Subtract node performs subtraction operations on provided inputs. This node has different versions which support several common data types, including: Audio, Float, Int32, and Time.

Frequency To MIDI.name: Frequency To MIDI
Frequency To MIDI.description: The Frequency To MIDI node converts a frequency value (in Hz) to a standard MIDI scale note value (where middle C is 60).

inputs.name: Frequency In
inputs.description: The input frequency value (in Hz).

outputs.name: Out MIDI
outputs.description: The output MIDI note value.

MIDI Note Quantizer.name: MIDI Note Quantizer
MIDI Note Quantizer.description: The MIDI Note Quantizer node quantizes a MIDI note to the nearest note that matches the provided criteria.

inputs.name: Note In
inputs.description: The MIDI note to quantize.

inputs.name: Root Note
inputs.description: The MIDI note to treat as the root. For example, a value of 0 equals C, a value of 1 equals C#/Db, and so on. The octave does not matter. Additionally, all values less than 0 clamp to 0.

inputs.name: Scale Degrees
inputs.description: An array containing a set of notes (in ascending order) representing half steps. The array must start with 0.0 to represent the root note and the highest value in the array must represent the root note in a higher octave, such as 12.0 for a single octave range or 24.0 for a two octave range.

outputs.name: Note Out
outputs.description: The quantized note.

MIDI To Frequency.name: MIDI To Frequency
MIDI To Frequency.description: The Frequency to MIDI node converts a standard MIDI scale note value (where middle C is 60) to a frequency value (in Hz). This node has two different versions which support Float and Int32 data types respectively.

inputs.name: MIDI In
inputs.description: The input value which represents a MIDI note value.

outputs.name: Out Frequency
outputs.description: The output frequency value (in Hz).

Scale to Note Array.name: Scale to Note Array
Scale to Note Array.description: The Scale to Note Array node returns an array of floating-point numbers representing notes of the selected scale.

inputs.name: Scale Degrees
inputs.description: The preset scale to get the notes for.

inputs.name: Chord Tones Only
inputs.description: If enabled, a subset of the scale representing chord tones is returned. For example, scale degrees of 1, 3, 5, and 7.

inputs.name: Next
inputs.description: The trigger on which to generate the next random value.

inputs.name: Reset
inputs.description: The trigger on which to reset the random sequence with the supplied seed.

inputs.name: Seed
inputs.description: The seed value to use for the randomization. The default value of -1 uses a random seed.

inputs.name: Min / Max
inputs.description: The inclusive range of the random value.

outputs.name: Scale Array Out
outputs.description: The array representation of the scale as half-steps above the root. The set is inclusive at both ends (starting at 0.0f and ending at 12.0f).

outputs.name: On Next
outputs.description: Triggers when the Next input is triggered.

outputs.name: On Reset
outputs.description: Triggers when the Reset input is triggered.

outputs.name: Value
outputs.description: The randomly generated value.

ITD Panner.name: ITD Panner
ITD Panner.description: The ITD Panner node pans an input audio signal using an interaural time delay method.

inputs.name: In
inputs.description: The input audio to spatialize.

inputs.name: Angle
inputs.description: The sound source angle (in degrees). A value of 90 degrees is front, 0 degrees is right, 270 degrees is behind, and 180 degrees is left.

inputs.name: Distance Factor
inputs.description: The normalized distance factor (0.0 to 1.0) to use for Interaural Level Difference (ILD) calculations. A value of 0.0 is near and a value of 1.0 is far. The further away the input audio is, the less difference in levels (gain) between the ears.

inputs.name: Head Width
inputs.description: The width (in centimeters) of the listener's head.

outputs.name: Out Left / Right
outputs.description: The audio output (left / right channel).

Mid-Side Decode.name: Mid-Side Decode
Mid-Side Decode.description: The Mid-Side Decode node converts a stereo signal with mid and side channels to left and right channels.

inputs.name: In Mid / Side
inputs.description: The audio channels to convert.

inputs.name: Spread Amount
inputs.description: The amount of stereo spread. A value of 0.0 produces no spread, a value of 0.5 is the original signal, and a value of 1.0 is fully wide.

inputs.name: Equal Power
inputs.description: If enabled, an equal power relationship between the input audio channels will be maintained.

outputs.name: Out Left / Right
outputs.description: The output audio channels.

Mid-Side Encode.name: Mid-Side Encode
Mid-Side Encode.description: The Mid-Side Encode node converts a stereo signal with left and right channels to mid and side channels.

inputs.name: In Left / Right
inputs.description: The audio channels to convert.

inputs.name: Spread Amount
inputs.description: The amount of stereo spread. A value of 0.0 produces no spread, a value of 0.5 is the original signal, and a value of 1.0 is fully wide.

inputs.name: Equal Power
inputs.description: If enabled, an equal power relationship between the input audio channels is maintained.

outputs.name: Out Mid / Side
outputs.description: The output audio channels.

Stereo Panner.name: Stereo Panner
Stereo Panner.description: The Stereo Panner node pans an input audio signal to left and right outputs.

inputs.name: In
inputs.description: The input audio signal to pan.

inputs.name: Pan Amount
inputs.description: The amount to pan the audio signal (-1.0 is fully left, 1.0 is fully right).

inputs.name: Panning Law
inputs.description:
The panning law to use:

  Equal Power: The power of the audio signal is constant while panning.
  Linear: The amplitude of the audio signal is constant while panning.

outputs.name: Out Left / Right
outputs.description: The output audio signal (left / right channels).

Trigger Accumulate.name: Trigger Accumulate
Trigger Accumulate.description: The Trigger Accumulate node triggers once all connected input triggers have been triggered at least once. There are multiple versions of this node in order to support different input counts (between 1 and 8).

inputs.name: In X
inputs.description: The trigger input(s).

inputs.name: Auto Reset
inputs.description: The trigger on which the accumulation on this node is reset.

outputs.name: Out
outputs.description: Triggers when all input triggers have been accumulated.

Trigger Any.name: Trigger Any
Trigger Any.description: The Trigger Any node triggers once any of the connected input triggers activate. This node has different versions which support different input counts (between 2 and 8).

inputs.name: In X
inputs.description: The trigger input(s).

outputs.name: Out
outputs.description: Triggers when any input trigger is triggered.

Trigger Compare.name: Trigger Compare
Trigger Compare.description: The Trigger Compare node triggers either true or false based on comparing connected inputs. This node has different versions which support several common data types, including: Bool, Float, and Int32.

inputs.name: Compare
inputs.description: The trigger on which to compare A and B.

inputs.name: A / B
inputs.description: The values to compare.

outputs.name: True / False
outputs.description: Triggers with the resulting trigger after making the comparison.

Trigger Control.name: Trigger Control
Trigger Control.description: The Trigger Control node provides controls to allow or block trigger signals from passing through to the output.

inputs.name: Trigger In
inputs.description: The input trigger to control.

inputs.name: Open
inputs.description: The trigger on which to allow the input trigger to pass through.

inputs.name: Close
inputs.description: The trigger on which to block the input trigger to pass through.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.description: The trigger on which to toggle the open/closed state of this node.

inputs.name: Start Closed
inputs.description: If enabled, the node will start in a closed state.

outputs.name: Trigger Out
outputs.description: The output trigger that passes through if the node is open.

Trigger Counter.name: Trigger Counter
Trigger Counter.description: The Trigger Counter node counts the connected input trigger activations.

inputs.name: In
inputs.description: The input trigger for which to count activations.

inputs.name: Reset
inputs.description: The trigger on which to reset the counter to zero and the value back to the start value.

inputs.name: Start Value
inputs.description: The value to start with on initialization and when reset.

inputs.name: Step Size
inputs.description: The value to add to the current value for each input trigger. This can be negative.

inputs.name: Reset Count
inputs.description: The number of input triggers to count before automatically resetting. If the value is set to 0, the node won't automatically reset.

outputs.name: On Trigger
outputs.description: Triggers when the input trigger is triggered and the count is updated.

outputs.name: On Reset
outputs.description: Triggers when the input reset is triggered or if the counter automatically resets.

outputs.name: Count
outputs.description: The current trigger count.

outputs.name: Value
outputs.description: The current value.

Trigger Delay.name: Trigger Delay
Trigger Delay.description: The Trigger Delay node executes a trigger after a given delay time from the most recent execution of the input trigger.

inputs.name: In
inputs.description: The input trigger to delay.

inputs.name: Reset
inputs.description: The trigger on which to reset the delay and clear the execution task, if it is pending.

inputs.name: Delay Time
inputs.description: The amount of time to delay the trigger (in seconds).

outputs.name: Out
outputs.description: The delayed output trigger.

Trigger Filter.name: Trigger Filter
Trigger Filter.description: The Trigger Filter node responds to a trigger by randomly activating one of the two output triggers.

inputs.name: Trigger
inputs.description: The trigger on which to randomly activate an output trigger.

inputs.name: Reset
inputs.description: The trigger on which to reset the random sequence with the provided seed.

inputs.name: Seed
inputs.description: The seed value to use for the randomization. A value of -1 will use a random seed.

inputs.name: Probability
inputs.description: The probability that a particular output trigger will get activated. For example, a value of 0.0 is always heads, a value of 1.0 is always tails, and 0.5 is equal odds.

outputs.name: Heads / Tails
outputs.description: The possible output triggers.

Trigger On Threshold.name: Trigger On Threshold
Trigger On Threshold.description: The Trigger On Threshold node operates as an edge detector and triggers when the input audio crosses a given threshold value while moving in the specified direction. This node has different versions which support several common data types, including: Audio, Float, and Int32.

inputs.name: In
inputs.description: The input audio signal.

inputs.name: Threshold
inputs.description: The threshold at which to trigger output.

outputs.name: Out
outputs.description: The output threshold trigger.

Trigger On Value Change.name: Trigger On Value Change
Trigger On Value Change.description: The Trigger On Value Change node triggers when a given value changes. This node has different versions which support several common data types, including: Bool, Float, and Int32.

inputs.name: Value
inputs.description: The input value to watch.

outputs.name: Trigger
outputs.description: The output trigger.

Trigger Once.name: Trigger Once
Trigger Once.description: The Trigger Once node triggers the first time an input trigger is activated and ignores all other occurrences, unless reset.

inputs.name: Trigger In
inputs.description: The input trigger.

inputs.name: Reset
inputs.description: The trigger on which to open the node and allow another trigger through.

inputs.name: Start Closed
inputs.description: If enabled, the node is closed when playback begins.

outputs.name: Trigger Out
outputs.description: The output trigger.

Trigger Pipe.name: Trigger Pipe
Trigger Pipe.description: The Trigger Pipe node delays execution of all input trigger signals by the given delay.

inputs.name: In
inputs.description: The input trigger to delay.

inputs.name: Reset
inputs.description: The trigger on which to reset the trigger delay and clear any pending execution tasks.

inputs.name: Delay Time
inputs.description: The time to delay the input trigger (in seconds).

outputs.name: Out
outputs.description: The delayed output trigger.

Trigger Repeat.name: Trigger Repeat
Trigger Repeat.description: The Trigger Repeat node emits a trigger periodically at a given sample-accurate and arbitrarily-precise rate.

inputs.name: Start / Stop
inputs.description: The triggers on which to start or stop executing periodic output triggers.

inputs.name: Period
inputs.description: The period to trigger (in seconds).

outputs.name: RepeatOut
outputs.description: The periodically generated output trigger.

Trigger Route.name: Trigger Route
Trigger Route.description: The Trigger Route node routes different input values to a single output value. This node has multiple versions for different input counts (between 2 and 8) and for each supported data type, including: Audio, Bool, Float, Int32, and Time.

inputs.name: Set X
inputs.description: The input triggers which initialize the routing. The default option is 0.

inputs.name: Value X
inputs.description: The input value to route to the output when triggered by its corresponding trigger.

outputs.name: On Set
outputs.description: Triggers when any of the input triggers are set.

outputs.name: Value
outputs.description: The output value set by an activated input trigger.

Trigger Select.name: Trigger Select
Trigger Select.description: The Trigger Select node passes triggers through to the currently selected output trigger. This node has multiple versions for different input counts (between 2 and 8).

inputs.name: In
inputs.description: The trigger to pass through.

inputs.name: Index
inputs.description: The output index to trigger. If the provided value is out of range, it will be ignored.

outputs.name: Out X
outputs.description: The output trigger at index X.

Trigger Sequence.name: Trigger Sequence
Trigger Sequence.description: The Trigger Sequence node responds to input triggers by sending the next output trigger in a sequence. This node has multiple versions which provide different numbers of output triggers (between 2 and 8).

inputs.name: In
inputs.description: The input trigger.

inputs.name: Reset
inputs.description: The trigger on which to reset the sequence back to 0.

inputs.name: Loop
inputs.description: If enabled, the sequence automatically loops back to 0 once all triggers have been activated.

outputs.name: Out X
outputs.description: The trigger outputs in sequence.

Trigger Toggle.name: Trigger Toggle
Trigger Toggle.description: The Trigger Toggle node toggles a Bool value on or off.

inputs.name: On / Off
inputs.description: The trigger on which to toggle the Bool output on or off.

inputs.name: Init
inputs.description: The initial states of the Bool.

inputs.name: Set
inputs.description: The trigger on which to write the set value to the output.

inputs.name: Reset
inputs.description: The trigger on which to reset the value to the initial value.

inputs.name: Init Value
inputs.description: The value to initialize the output value to.

inputs.name: Target Value
inputs.description: The value to set the output to when triggered.

outputs.name: Out
outputs.description: Triggers when the Bool is toggled.

outputs.name: Value
outputs.description: The current Bool value.

outputs.name: On Set
outputs.description: Triggers when the value is set.

outputs.name: On Reset
outputs.description: Triggers when the value is reset.

outputs.name: Output Value
outputs.description: The current output value.
